wikipedia_page.main:
Mike LeRoy (1937-2020), born Michael Robinson-Learoyd on 18 March 1937, was a writer and singer.
Leroy sang the theme song to the 1965 film, A High Wind in Jamaica. He also sang "With a Little Love" in 1970, which was subsequently used on the Attila the Hun sketch of Monty Python's Flying Circus.

link_mentions.page: List of Monty Python's Flying Circus episodes
response: **parody of The Debbie Reynolds Show (1969), recreating the opening credits shot for shot and using a knock-off of the theme "With A Little Love" by Mike LeRoy.
The title song was produced and written by Larry Adler and sung by Mike LeRoy.

link_mentions.page: No One Knows (Dion and The Belmonts song)
response: *Mike LeRoy released a version of the song as the B-side to his single "I Forgot What It Was Like" in October 1964.Mike LeRoy, "No One Knows" single release Retrieved July 8, 2014
